item.title: Report X-2025010810
item.description:
Report X-2025010810

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: SEATAC
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location a damaged fiberboard ripped open showing the contents to be undeclared DG. Inside of a the fiberboard box was a smaller box labeled as a UN1070 there were no markings or paperwork on the outer box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: outer package/fibreboard box damaged in transit to reveal undeclared dg in inner packaging. 2 metal bottles of nitrous oxide. inner package was marked and labeled with proper shipping name, un number, and hazard labels. no release. secured in salvage drum pending FAA inspection.

item.title: Report E-2025010198
item.description:
Report E-2025010198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-21
  • City: RENTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:05 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (USE) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 cup of System 15-System XFR (hazardous - UN1133) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri was placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2025010667
item.description:
Report X-2025010667

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BNSF personnel identified a potential release from the TILX 360231 while the car was in the Pasco Bowl Track 43. The car was isolated pending inspection by BNSF Hazmat personnel. Upon inspection, gasoline vapor was found emitting from the manway between the nozzle and hinged lid. The manway was opened and found that the gasket was misaligned and not sealing completely. The gasket was replaced with a nozzle gasket and the lid secured. A new seal was installed and the car was released. There were no identified ground impacts from the release and gasoline spilled on the car had evaporated. Estimated release volume is based upon responder observations.
